Board and Management Involvement
11The Board and Board Committees met on 36 occasions in 2020 to discuss, monitor and plan the company’s
response to the impact of Covid- 19 on aviation

i
dentification of the threat of the emerging Covid-
19 crisis to aviation by adjusting the frequency of board meetings and the matters discussed at these meetings. These changes meant that the Company could reach a consensus quickly on appropriate actions and move at the necessary speed to manage emerging risks
ESG matters remained a key focus of the Board and Management during 2020
In addition to maintaining the current Board review cycle of ESG matters, certain areas received heightened Board focus as the Covid -19 
crisis developed
These included:
Caring for the health and well -being of 
employees and their families 
Supporting our customers and suppliers
Contributing positively to our communitiesInitial 
ResponseAt the start of the pandemic, Board update meetings were convened on a weekly basis as the company’s corporate priorities, crisis management and action plans were developed,agreed and executed
Ongoing 
Dialogue Maintained engagement with all key stakeholders to ensure clear communication and that all relevant priorities were understood 
Relevant pre-existing communications (e.g., disclosure of the 
company’s risk factors in its annual report) were reassessed to 
ensure they remained up -to-date and that they reflected the 
impact of Covid- 19 as the pandemic progressed
Key Areas 
of FocusParticular focus on liquidity management; the financial health of 
customer airlines and of OEMs; business continuity; and the well- being of employees
Impact 
AssessmentThe Board and Audit Committee considered in detail the impact of the crisis on processes and controls, including the impact of increased remote working and of increased cyber/fraud threats. The Internal Audit plan was updated accordingly
